## Methodology

### Comparison framework

**Source A:** [What is being assessed?]

- Dataset ID: `[dataset.id]`
- Version: [Version Number]
- Record count: [N]
- Coverage: [What does this dataset cover?]

**Source B:** [What is the benchmark or requirement?]

- Dataset ID: `[dataset.id]`
- Version: [Version Number]
- Record count: [N]
- Coverage: [What does this dataset require?]

### Gap classification

Gaps are classified using a 2√ó2 matrix:

| Impact | Urgency | Classification | Priority |
|--------|---------|----------------|----------|
| High | High | **Critical** | Address immediately (Q1-Q2) |
| High | Medium | **Moderate** | Address soon (Q3-Q4) |
| Medium | High | **Moderate** | Address soon (Q3-Q4) |
| Medium | Medium | **Low-priority** | Address later (next year) |
| Low | Any | **Low-priority** | Monitor, defer |

### Mapping confidence

Mappings are scored for confidence:

- **Direct:** 1:1 mapping with identical semantics (90-100% confidence)
- **Partial:** Approximate mapping requiring transformation (50-89% confidence)
- **Missing:** No suitable mapping exists (0-49% confidence)

## GS1 Style Guide compliance checklist

<!-- 
Delete this section before delivery
-->

- [ ] **Date format:** DD Month YYYY
- [ ] **Headings:** Sentence case
- [ ] **Abbreviations:** Spelled out on first use
- [ ] **British English:** analyse, organisation, standardise
- [ ] **"standard" not capitalised:** "GS1 standards"
- [ ] **"e.g.," with comma:** "e.g., example"
- [ ] **No Oxford comma:** "A, B and C"
- [ ] **Tables accessible:** Headers defined
